page.title: 19School Bird Survey
page.content: During the spring of 1985 our class carried out a survey of the birds which either visited or we could see from our school grounds. We were very surprised at the total number of different birds that we saw. These were the birds we recorded in the spring:Heron,Kestrel,Woodpigeon, Blue Tit,Mistle Thrush,Song Thrush, Blackbird,Robin,Pied Wagtail, Starling Greenfinch,Goldfinch,Linnet, Chaffinch House Sparrow. Later in the year House Martins and Swifts were seen. Later still Swifts were seen. Many of these summer visitors nest on our houses. We were especially pleased to see several Herons coming from the direction of{Vicar's Pond}and flying north.We have also recorded at other times of the year{seabirds}including Blackbacked Gulls.
